   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, one client, one server.
   23: %% The traffic isn't meant to be sensible, just to exercise code.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_traffic_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0,
   30:          run/1]).
   31: 
   32: %% common_test wrapping
   33: -export([
   34:          %% Framework functions
   35:          suite/0,
   36:          all/0,
   37:          init_per_suite/1,
   38:          end_per_suite/1,
   39:          init_per_testcase/2,
   40:          end_per_testcase/2,
   41:         
   42:          %% The test cases
   43:          parallel/1
   44:         ]).
   45: 
   46: %% testcases
   47: -export([send_ok/1,
   48:          send_nok/1,
   49:          send_eval/1,
   50:          send_bad_answer/1,
   51:          send_protocol_error/1,
   52:          send_experimental_result/1,
   53:          send_arbitrary/1,
   54:          send_proxy_info/1,
   55:          send_unknown/1,
   56:          send_unknown_short/1,
   57:          send_unknown_mandatory/1,
   58:          send_unknown_short_mandatory/1,
   59:          send_noreply/1,
   60:          send_grouped_error/1,
   61:          send_unsupported/1,
   62:          send_unsupported_app/1,
   63:          send_error_bit/1,
   64:          send_unsupported_version/1,
   65:          send_long_avp_length/1,
   66:          send_short_avp_length/1,
   67:          send_zero_avp_length/1,
   68:          send_invalid_avp_length/1,
   69:          send_invalid_reject/1,
   70:          send_unexpected_mandatory_decode/1,
   71:          send_unexpected_mandatory/1,
   72:          send_too_many/1,
   73:          send_long/1,
   74:          send_maxlen/1,
   75:          send_nopeer/1,
   76:          send_noapp/1,
   77:          send_discard/1,
   78:          send_any_1/1,
   79:          send_any_2/1,
   80:          send_all_1/1,
   81:          send_all_2/1,
   82:          send_timeout/1,
   83:          send_error/1,
   84:          send_detach/1,
   85:          send_encode_error/1,
   86:          send_destination_1/1,
   87:          send_destination_2/1,
   88:          send_destination_3/1,
   89:          send_destination_4/1,
   90:          send_destination_5/1,
   91:          send_destination_6/1,
   92:          send_destination_7/1,
   93:          send_bad_option_1/1,
   94:          send_bad_option_2/1,
   95:          send_bad_filter_1/1,
   96:          send_bad_filter_2/1,
   97:          send_bad_filter_3/1,
   98:          send_bad_filter_4/1,
   99:          send_multiple_filters_1/1,
  100:          send_multiple_filters_2/1,
  101:          send_multiple_filters_3/1,
  102:          send_anything/1]).
  103: 
  104: %% diameter callbacks
  105: -export([peer_up/4,
  106:          peer_down/4,
  107:          pick_peer/7, pick_peer/8,
  108:          prepare_request/6, prepare_request/7,
  109:          prepare_retransmit/6,
  110:          handle_answer/7, handle_answer/8,
  111:          handle_error/7,
  112:          handle_request/4]).
  113: 
  114: %% diameter_{tcp,sctp} callbacks
  115: -export([message/3]).
  116: 
  117: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet_sctp.hrl").
  118: 
  119: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
  120: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
  121: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_accounting.hrl").
  122: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
  123: 
  124: 
  125: %% The listening transports use RFC 3588 dictionaries, the client
  126: %% transports use either 3588 or 6733. (So can't use the record
  127: %% definitions in the latter case.)
  128: 
  129: %% ===========================================================================
  130: 
  131: -define(A, list_to_atom).
  132: -define(L, atom_to_list).
  133: -define(B, iolist_to_binary).
  134: 
  135: -define(TRL(F),    ?TRL(F, [])).
  136: -define(TRL(F, A), ?LOG("DTR", F, A)).
  137: 
  138: %% ===========================================================================
  139: 
  140: %% Don't use is_record/2 since dictionary hrl's aren't included.
  141: %% (Since they define conflicting records with the same names.)
  142: -define(is_record(Rec, Name), (Name == element(1, Rec))).
  143: 
  144: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
  145: 
  146: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
  147: -define(HOST(Host, Realm), Host ++ [$.|Realm]).
  148: 
  149: -define(EXTRA, an_extra_argument).
  150: 
  151: %% Sequence mask for End-to-End and Hop-by-Hop identifiers.
  152: -define(CLIENT_MASK, {1,26}).  %% 1 in top 6 bits
  153: 
  154: %% How to construct outgoing messages.
  155: -define(ENCODINGS, [list, record, map]).
  156: 
  157: %% How to decode incoming messages.
  158: -define(DECODINGS, [record, none, map, list, record_from_map]).
  159: 
  160: %% Which dictionary to use in the clients.
  161: -define(RFCS, [rfc3588, rfc6733, rfc4005]).
  162: 
  163: %% Which transport protocol to use.
  164: -define(TRANSPORTS, [sctp || ?HAVE_SCTP()] ++ [tcp]).
  165: 
  166: -record(group, {transport,
  167:                 strings,
  168:                 encoding,
  169:                 client_service,
  170:                 client_dict,
  171:                 client_sender,
  172:                 server_service,
  173:                 server_decoding,
  174:                 server_sender,
  175:                 server_throttle}).
  176: 
  177: %% Not really what we should be setting unless the message is sent in
  178: %% the common application but diameter doesn't care.
  179: -define(APP_ID, ?DIAMETER_APP_ID_COMMON).
  180: 
  181: %% An Application-ID the server doesn't support.
  182: -define(BAD_APP, 42).
  183: 
  184: %% A common match when receiving answers in a client.
  185: -define(answer_message(SessionId, ResultCode),
  186:         ['answer-message' | #{'Session-Id' := SessionId,
  187:                               'Origin-Host' := _,
  188:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  189:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  190: -define(answer_message(ResultCode),
  191:         ['answer-message' | #{'Origin-Host' := _,
  192:                               'Origin-Realm' := _,
  193:                               'Result-Code' := ResultCode}]).
  194: 
  195: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
  196: -define(SERVICE(Name, Grp),
  197:         [{'Origin-Host', Name ++ "." ++ ?REALM},
  198:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
  199:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
  200:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
  201:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
  202:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]},  %% common messages
  203:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]},  %% base accounting
  204:          {restrict_connections, false},
  205:          {string_decode, Grp#group.strings},
  206:          {avp_dictionaries, [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683]},
  207:          {incoming_maxlen, 1 bsl 21}
  208:          | [{application, [{dictionary, D},
  209:                            {module, [?MODULE, Grp]},
  210:                            {answer_errors, callback}]}
  211:             || D <- [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  212:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting,
  213:                      diameter_gen_base_rfc6733,
  214:                      diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733,
  215:                      nas4005],
  216:                D /= nas4005 orelse have_nas()]]).
  217: 
  218: -define(SUCCESS,
  219:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_SUCCESS').
  220: -define(COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  221:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED').
  222: -define(TOO_BUSY,
  223:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_TOO_BUSY').
  224: -define(APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  225:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED').
  226: -define(INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  227:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_HDR_BITS').
  228: -define(INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  229:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_BITS').
  230: -define(AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  231:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_UNSUPPORTED').
  232: -define(UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  233:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION').
  234: -define(TOO_MANY,
  235:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_AVP_OCCURS_TOO_MANY_TIMES').
  236: -define(REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  237:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_REALM_NOT_SERVED').
  238: -define(UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  239:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_UNABLE_TO_DELIVER').
  240: -define(INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  241:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_AVP_LENGTH').
  242: 
  243: -define(EVENT_RECORD,
  244:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_ACCOUNTING-RECORD-TYPE_EVENT_RECORD').
  245: -define(AUTHORIZE_ONLY,
  246:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_ONLY').
  247: -define(AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE,
  248:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE').
  249: 
  250: -define(LOGOUT,
  251:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  252: -define(BAD_ANSWER,
  253:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_BAD_ANSWER').
  254: -define(USER_MOVED,
  255:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
  256: 
  257: %% ===========================================================================
  258: %% common_test wrapping
  259: 
  260: suite() ->
  261:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  262: 
  263: all() ->
  264:     [parallel].
  265: 
  266: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  267:     ?TRL("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  268:          "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  269:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
  270: 
  271: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  272:     ?TRL("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  273:          "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  274:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  275: 
  276: 
  277: %% This test case can take a *long* time, so if the machine is too slow, skip
  278: init_per_testcase(parallel = Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     ?TRL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> check factor", [Case]),
  280:     Key = dia_factor,
  281:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
  282:         {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 10) ->
  283:             ?TRL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> Too slow (~w) => SKIP",
  284:                  [Case, Factor]),
  285:             {skip, {machine_too_slow, Factor}};
  286:         _ ->
  287:             ?TRL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> run test", [Case]),
  288:             Config
  289:     end;
  290: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  291:     ?TRL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  292:     Config.
  293: 
  294: 
  295: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  296:     ?TRL("end_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  297:     Config.
  298: 
  299: 
  300: parallel(_Config) ->
  301:     run().
  302: 
  303: 
  304: %% ===========================================================================
  305: 
  306: %% run/0
  307: %%
  308: %% The test cases proper, do or (meaningfully) die.
  309: %%
  310: %% Randomly choose one of many configuration possibilities. Testing
  311: %% all of them takes too much time, and randomly skipping various
  312: %% cases (as used to be the case) just unnecessary complexity. There
  313: %% are run night after night in on various hosts, so just choosing a
  314: %% configuration results in sufficient coverage over time.
  315: 
  316: run() ->
  317:     %% ok = logger:set_primary_config(level, debug),
  318:     Svc = ?UNIQUE_STRING(),
  319:     run(#group{transport = ?CHOOSE(?TRANSPORTS),
  320:                strings = bool(),
  321:                encoding = ?CHOOSE(?ENCODINGS),
  322:                client_service = [$C | Svc],
  323:                client_dict = appdict(?CHOOSE(?RFCS)),
  324:                client_sender = bool(),
  325:                server_service = [$S | Svc],
  326:                server_decoding = ?CHOOSE(?DECODINGS),
  327:                server_sender = true,  %% avoid deadlock
  328:                server_throttle = bool()}).
  329: 
  330: %% run/1
  331: 
  332: run(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  333:     _ = result_codes(Cfg),
  334:     ?TRL("config:"
  335:          "~n   ~p", [Cfg]),
  336:     try
  337:         ?RUN([{[fun traffic/1, Cfg], 60000}])
  338:     after
  339:         code:delete(nas4005),
  340:         code:purge(nas4005),
  341:         diameter:stop()
  342:     end.
  343: 
  344: %% traffic/1
  345: 
  346: traffic(#group{} = Cfg) ->
  347:     ?TRL("~w -> compile and load", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  348:     _ = compile_and_load(),
  349:     ?TRL("~w -> start diameter", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  350:     ok = diameter:start(),
  351:     ?TRL("~w -> start server", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  352:     LRef = server(Cfg),
  353:     ?TRL("~w -> start client", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  354:     ok = client(Cfg, LRef),
  355:     ?TRL("~w -> send", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  356:     [] = send(Cfg),
  357:     ?TRL("~w -> print service(s) info", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  358:     print_services_info(),
  359:     ?TRL("~w -> stop service(s)", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  360:     ok = stop_services(Cfg),
  361:     ?TRL("~w -> verify (no remaining) requests", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  362:     [] = ets:tab2list(diameter_request),
  363:     ?TRL("~w -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  364:     ok.
  365: 
  366: 
  367: print_services_info() ->
  368:     print_services_info(diameter:services()).
  369: 
  370: print_services_info([]) ->
  371:     io:format("~n", []);
  372: print_services_info([Service | Services]) ->
  373:     io:format("~n   Service: ~s"
  374:               "~n      Config:"
  375:               "~n         ~p"
  376:               "~n      Which Connections:"
  377:               "~n         ~p"
  378:               "~n      Which Connections/Service:"
  379:               "~n         ~p"
  380:               "~n      Which Watchdogs:"
  381:               "~n         ~p"
  382:               "~n      Which Watchdogs/Service:"
  383:               "~n         ~p"
  384:               "~n      Which Transports:"
  385:               "~n         ~p"
  386:               "~n      Which Transports/Service:"
  387:               "~n         ~p"
  388:               "~n      Peers Info:"
  389:               "~n         ~p"
  390:               "~n      Transport Info:"
  391:               "~n         ~p"
  392:               "~n      All info:"
  393:               "~n         ~p",
  394:               [Service,
  395:                diameter_config:lookup(Service),
  396:                diameter:which_connections(),
  397:                diameter:which_connections(Service),
  398:                diameter:which_watchdogs(),
  399:                diameter:which_watchdogs(Service),
  400:                diameter:which_transports(),
  401:                diameter:which_transports(Service),
  402:                diameter:service_info(Service, peers),
  403:                diameter:service_info(Service, transport),
  404:                diameter:service_info(Service, all)]),
  405:     print_services_info(Services).
  406: 
  407: 
  408: %% start_service/2
  409: 
  410: start_service(Svc, Opts) ->
  411:     {ok, _} = {diameter:start_service(Svc, Opts), Opts},
  412:     ok.
  413: 
  414: %% send/1
  415: 
  416: send(Cfg) ->
  417:     Ref = make_ref(),
  418:     Refs = [R || {F,1} <- module_info(exports),
  419:                  "send_" ++ _ <- [atom_to_list(F)],
  420:                  I <- [fun() -> exit({Ref, send(F, Cfg)}) end],
  421:                  {_,R} <- [spawn_monitor(I)]],
  422:     lists:filter(fun({R,_}) -> R /= Ref; (_) -> true end, wait(Refs)).
  423: 
  424: %% send/2
  425: 
  426: send(F, #group{transport = sctp})
  427:   when F == send_long;
  428:        F == send_maxlen ->
  429:     ok;
  430: 
  431: send(F, Cfg) ->
  432:     timer:sleep(rand:uniform(2000)),
  433:     apply(?MODULE, F, [[{testcase, F}, {group, Cfg}]]).
  434: 
  435: %% wait/1
  436: 
  437: wait(Refs)
  438:   when is_list(Refs) ->
  439:     lists:map(fun wait/1, Refs);
  440: 
  441: wait(MRef) ->
  442:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, T} -> T end.
  443: 
  444: %% ===========================================================================
  445: 
  446: %% server/1
  447: 
  448: server(Config) ->
  449: 
  450:     logger:debug("entry with"
  451:                  "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  452: 
  453:     #group{transport = T,
  454:            client_sender = CS,
  455:            server_service = SN,
  456:            server_decoding = SD,
  457:            server_sender = SS,
  458:            server_throttle = ST}
  459:         = Grp
  460:         = group(Config),
  461:     ok = start_service(SN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  462:                             {decode_format, SD},
  463:                             {bins_info, bins_info()}
  464:                             | ?SERVICE(SN, Grp)]),
  465:     Cfg = [{sender, SS},
  466:            {message_cb, ST andalso {?MODULE, message, [0]}}]
  467:         ++ [{packet, ?CHOOSE([false, raw])} || T == sctp andalso CS]
  468:         ++ [{unordered, unordered()} || T == sctp],
  469:     Opts = [{capabilities_cb, fun capx/2},
  470:             {pool_size, 8}
  471:            | server_apps()],
  472:     _LRef = ?LISTEN(SN, [T | Cfg], Opts).
  473: 
  474: %% client/1
  475: 
  476: client(Config, LRef) ->
  477: 
  478:     logger:debug("entry with"
  479:                  "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  480: 
  481:     #group{transport = T,
  482:            encoding = E,
  483:            client_service = CN,
  484:            client_sender = CS}
  485:         = Grp
  486:         = group(Config),
  487:     ok = start_service(CN, [{traffic_counters, bool()},
  488:                             {sequence, ?CLIENT_MASK},
  489:                             {decode_format, map},
  490:                             {strict_arities, decode},
  491:                             {bins_info, bins_info()}
  492:                             | ?SERVICE(CN, Grp)]),
  493:     _ = [?CONNECT(CN, [T | C], LRef, O)
  494:          || C <- [[{sender, CS} | client_opts(T)]],
  495:             D <- ?DECODINGS,  %% for multiple candidate peers
  496:             R <- ?RFCS,
  497:             R /= rfc4005 orelse have_nas(),
  498:             I <- [{D,E}],
  499:             O <- [[{id, I}
  500:                   | client_apps(R, [{'Origin-State-Id', origin(I)}])]]],
  501:     ok.
  502: 
  503: bool() ->
  504:     0.5 =< rand:uniform().
  505: 
  506: bins_info() ->
  507:     %% Three possibilities: true | false | non_neg_integer()
  508:     %% We choose a low range, 42, only because our test does not
  509:     %% actually stress the system, so no point in picking a large
  510:     %% number.
  511:     ?CHOOSE([true, false, rand:uniform(42)]).
  512: 
  513: unordered() ->
  514:     ?CHOOSE([true, false, 1, 2]).
  515: 
  516: client_opts(tcp) ->
  517:     [];
  518: client_opts(sctp) ->
  519:     [{unordered, unordered()}
  520:      | [{sctp_initmsg, #sctp_initmsg{num_ostreams = N,
  521:                                      max_instreams = 5}}
  522:         || N <- [rand:uniform(8)],
  523:            N =< 6]].
  524: 
  525: server_apps() ->
  526:     B = have_nas(),
  527:     [{applications, [diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
  528:                      diameter_gen_base_accounting]
  529:                     ++ [nas4005 || B]},
  530:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [0] ++ [1 || B]}, %% common, NAS
  531:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', [3]}]}].          %% accounting
  532: 
  533: client_apps(rfc4005, Caps) ->
  534:     [{applications, [nas4005]},
  535:      {capabilities, [{'Auth-Application-Id', [1]},     %% NAS
  536:                      {'Acct-Application-Id', []}
  537:                     | Caps]}];
  538: client_apps(D, Caps) ->
  539:     D0 = dict0(D),
  540:     [{applications, [acct(D0), D0]},
  541:      {capabilities, Caps}].
  542: 
  543: have_nas() ->
  544:     false /= code:is_loaded(nas4005).
  545: 
  546: stop_services(Config) ->
  547:     #group{client_service = CN,
  548:            server_service = SN}
  549:         = group(Config),
  550:     ok = diameter:stop_service(CN),
  551:     ok = diameter:stop_service(SN).
  552: 
  553: capx(_, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,DH}}) ->
  554:     io:format("connection: ~p -> ~p~n", [DH,OH]),
  555:     ok.
  556: 
  557: %% ===========================================================================
  558: 
  559: %% Ensure that result codes have the expected values.
  560: result_codes(_Config) ->
  561:     {2001,
  562:      3001, 3002, 3003, 3004, 3007, 3008, 3009,
  563:      5001, 5009, 5011, 5014}
  564:         = {?SUCCESS,
  565:            ?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED,
  566:            ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER,
  567:            ?REALM_NOT_SERVED,
  568:            ?TOO_BUSY,
  569:            ?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED,
  570:            ?INVALID_HDR_BITS,
  571:            ?INVALID_AVP_BITS,
  572:            ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  573:            ?TOO_MANY,
  574:            ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION,
  575:            ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH}.
  576: 
  577: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  578: send_ok(Config) ->
  579:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  580:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 1}],
  581:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  582:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  583:         = call(Config, Req).
  584: 
  585: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server answers badly to.
  586: send_nok(Config) ->
  587:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  588:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 0}],
  589: 
  590:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_AVP_BITS)
  591:         = call(Config, Req).
  592: 
  593: %% Send an ACR and expect success.
  594: send_eval(Config) ->
  595:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  596:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 3}],
  597: 
  598:     ['ACA' | #{'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  599:                'Session-Id' := _}]
  600:         = call(Config, Req).
  601: 
  602: %% Send an accounting ACR that the server tries to answer with an
  603: %% inappropriate header. That the error is detected is coded in
  604: %% handle_answer.
  605: send_bad_answer(Config) ->
  606:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  607:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 2}],
  608:     ?answer_message(?SUCCESS)
  609:         = call(Config, Req).
  610: 
  611: %% Send an ACR that the server callback answers explicitly with a
  612: %% protocol error and some AVPs to check the decoding of.
  613: send_protocol_error(Config) ->
  614:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  615:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 4}],
  616: 
  617:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := ?TOO_BUSY,
  618:                           'AVP' := [OLR | _]} = Avps]
  619:         = call(Config, Req),
  620: 
  621:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-OLR',
  622:                   value = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' := 1,
  623:                             'OC-Report-Type' := 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
  624:                             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' := [25],
  625:                             'OC-Validity-Duration' := [60],
  626:                             'AVP' := [OSF]}}
  627:         = OLR,
  628:     #diameter_avp{name = 'OC-Supported-Features',
  629:                   value = #{} = Fs}
  630:         = OSF,
  631:     0 = maps:size(Fs),
  632: 
  633:     #group{client_dict = D} = group(Config), 
  634: 
  635:     if D == nas4005 ->
  636:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  637:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  638:                 = Avps,
  639:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  640:                           value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  641:                 = Failed,
  642:             #diameter_avp{name = 'NAS-Port',
  643:                           value = 44}
  644:                 = NP,
  645:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  646:                           value = 12}
  647:                 = FR,
  648:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  649:                           value = 13}
  650:                 = AP;
  651: 
  652:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
  653:        D == diameter_gen_basr_accounting ->
  654:             error = maps:find('Failed-AVP', Avps),
  655:             #{'AVP' := [_,Failed]}
  656:                 = Avps,
  657: 
  658:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Failed-AVP',
  659:                            value = #{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}}
  660:                 = Failed,
  661:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  662:                           value = undefined}
  663:                 = NP,
  664:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  665:                           value = 12}
  666:                 = FR,
  667:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  668:                           value = 13}
  669:                 = AP;
  670: 
  671:        D == diameter_gen_base_rfc6733;
  672:        D == diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733 ->
  673:             #{'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [NP,FR,AP]}],
  674:               'AVP' := [_]}
  675:                 = Avps,
  676:             #diameter_avp{name = undefined,
  677:                           value = undefined}
  678:                 = NP,
  679:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision',
  680:                           value = 12}
  681:                 = FR,
  682:             #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period',
  683:                           value = 13}
  684:                 = AP
  685:     end.
  686: 
  687: %% Send a 3xxx Experimental-Result in an answer not setting the E-bit
  688: %% and missing a Result-Code.
  689: send_experimental_result(Config) ->
  690:     Req = ['ACR', {'Accounting-Record-Type', ?EVENT_RECORD},
  691:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', 5}],
  692:     ['ACA' | #{'Session-Id' := _}]
  693:         = call(Config, Req).
  694: 
  695: %% Send an ASR with an arbitrary non-mandatory AVP and expect success
  696: %% and the same AVP in the reply.
  697: send_arbitrary(Config) ->
  698:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  699:                                          value = "XXX"}]}],
  700:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  701:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  702:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{name = 'Product-Name',
  703:                                        value = V}]}]
  704:         = call(Config, Req),
  705:     "XXX" = string(V, Config).
  706: 
  707: %% Send Proxy-Info in an ASR that the peer answers with 3xxx, and
  708: %% ensure that the AVP is returned.
  709: send_proxy_info(Config) ->
  710:     H0 = ?B(?UNIQUE_STRING()),
  711:     S0 = ?B(?UNIQUE_STRING()),
  712:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', #{'Proxy-Host'  => H0,
  713:                                    'Proxy-State' => S0}}],
  714:     ['answer-message' | #{'Result-Code' := 3999,
  715:                           'Proxy-Info' := [#{'Proxy-Host' := H,
  716:                                              'Proxy-State' := S}]}]
  717:         = call(Config, Req),
  718:     [H0, S0] = [?B(X) || X <- [H,S]].
  719: 
  720: %% Send an unknown AVP (to some client) and check that it comes back.
  721: send_unknown(Config) ->
  722:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  723:                                          is_mandatory = false,
  724:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  725:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  726:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS,
  727:                'AVP' := [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  728:                                        is_mandatory = false,
  729:                                        data = <<17>>}]}]
  730:         = call(Config, Req).
  731: 
  732: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  733: %% 5014.
  734: send_unknown_short(Config) ->
  735:     send_unknown_short(Config, false, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  736: 
  737: send_unknown_short(Config, M, RC) ->
  738:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  739:                                          is_mandatory = M,
  740:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  741:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  742:                'Result-Code' := RC,
  743:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  744:         = call(Config, Req),
  745:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  746:                   is_mandatory = M,
  747:                   data = <<17, _/binary>>} %% extra bits from padding
  748:         = Avp.
  749: 
  750: %% Ditto but set the M flag.
  751: send_unknown_mandatory(Config) ->
  752:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 999,
  753:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  754:                                          data = <<17>>}]}],
  755:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  756:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  757:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  758:         = call(Config, Req),
  759:     #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  760:                   is_mandatory = true,
  761:                   data = <<17>>}
  762:         = Avp.
  763: 
  764: %% Ditto, and point the AVP length past the end of the message. Expect
  765: %% 5014 instead of 5001.
  766: send_unknown_short_mandatory(Config) ->
  767:     send_unknown_short(Config, true, ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH).
  768: 
  769: %% Send an ASR containing an unexpected mandatory Session-Timeout.
  770: %% Expect 5001, and check that the value in Failed-AVP was decoded.
  771: send_unexpected_mandatory_decode(Config) ->
  772:     Req = ['ASR', {'AVP', [#diameter_avp{code = 27,  %% Session-Timeout
  773:                                          is_mandatory = true,
  774:                                          data = <<12:32>>}]}],
  775:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  776:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED,
  777:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  778:         = call(Config, Req),
  779:     #diameter_avp{code = 27,
  780:                   is_mandatory = true,
  781:                   value = 12,
  782:                   data = <<12:32>>}
  783:         = Avp.
  784: 
  785: %% Try to two Auth-Application-Id in ASR expect 5009.
  786: send_too_many(Config) ->
  787:     Req = ['ASR', {'Auth-Application-Id', [?APP_ID, 44]}],
  788: 
  789:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  790:                'Result-Code' := ?TOO_MANY,
  791:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  792:         = call(Config, Req),
  793:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Application-Id',
  794:                   value = 44}
  795:         = Avp.
  796: 
  797: %% Send an containing a faulty Grouped AVP (empty Proxy-Host in
  798: %% Proxy-Info) and expect that only the faulty AVP is sent in
  799: %% Failed-AVP. The encoded values of Proxy-Host and Proxy-State are
  800: %% swapped in prepare_request since an empty Proxy-Host is an encode
  801: %% error.
  802: send_grouped_error(Config) ->
  803:     Req = ['ASR', {'Proxy-Info', [[{'Proxy-Host', "abcd"},
  804:                                    {'Proxy-State', ""}]]}],
  805:     ['ASA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  806:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  807:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [Avp]}]}]
  808:         = call(Config, Req),
  809:     #diameter_avp{name = 'Proxy-Info', value = #{'Proxy-Host' := H}}
  810:         = Avp,
  811:     <<0>> = ?B(H).
  812: 
  813: %% Send an STR that the server ignores.
  814: send_noreply(Config) ->
  815:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  816:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  817: 
  818: %% Send an unsupported command and expect 3001.
  819: send_unsupported(Config) ->
  820:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  821:     ?answer_message(?COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED)
  822:         = call(Config, Req).
  823: 
  824: %% Send an unsupported application and expect 3007.
  825: send_unsupported_app(Config) ->
  826:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  827:     ?answer_message(?APPLICATION_UNSUPPORTED)
  828:         = call(Config, Req).
  829: 
  830: %% Send a request with the E bit set and expect 3008.
  831: send_error_bit(Config) ->
  832:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?BAD_ANSWER}],
  833:     ?answer_message(?INVALID_HDR_BITS)
  834:         = call(Config, Req).
  835: 
  836: %% Send a bad version and check that we get 5011.
  837: send_unsupported_version(Config) ->
  838:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  839:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  840:                'Result-Code' := ?UNSUPPORTED_VERSION}]
  841:         = call(Config, Req).
  842: 
  843: %% Send a request containing an AVP length > data size.
  844: send_long_avp_length(Config) ->
  845:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  846: 
  847: %% Send a request containing an AVP length < data size.
  848: send_short_avp_length(Config) ->
  849:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  850: 
  851: %% Send a request containing an AVP whose advertised length is < 8.
  852: send_zero_avp_length(Config) ->
  853:     send_invalid_avp_length(Config).
  854: 
  855: %% Send a request containing an AVP length that doesn't match the
  856: %% AVP's type.
  857: send_invalid_avp_length(Config) ->
  858:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  859: 
  860:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  861:                'Result-Code' := ?INVALID_AVP_LENGTH,
  862:                'Origin-Host' := _,
  863:                'Origin-Realm' := _,
  864:                'Failed-AVP' := [#{'AVP' := [_]}]}]
  865:         = call(Config, Req).
  866: 
  867: %% Send a request containing 5xxx errors that the server rejects with
  868: %% 3xxx.
  869: send_invalid_reject(Config) ->
  870:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?USER_MOVED}],
  871: 
  872:     ?answer_message(?TOO_BUSY)
  873:         = call(Config, Req).
  874: 
  875: %% Send an STR containing a known AVP, but one that's not expected and
  876: %% that sets the M-bit.
  877: send_unexpected_mandatory(Config) ->
  878:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  879: 
  880:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  881:                'Result-Code' := ?AVP_UNSUPPORTED}]
  882:         = call(Config, Req).
  883: 
  884: %% Send something long that will be fragmented by TCP.
  885: send_long(Config) ->
  886:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  887:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 20)]}],
  888:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  889:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  890:         = call(Config, Req).
  891: 
  892: %% Send something longer than the configure incoming_maxlen.
  893: send_maxlen(Config) ->
  894:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  895:                   {'User-Name', [binary:copy(<<$X>>, 1 bsl 21)]}],
  896:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req).
  897: 
  898: %% Send something for which pick_peer finds no suitable peer.
  899: send_nopeer(Config) ->
  900:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  901:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [?EXTRA]}]).
  902: 
  903: %% Send something on an unconfigured application.
  904: send_noapp(Config) ->
  905:     #group{client_service = CN}
  906:         = group(Config),
  907:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  908:     {error, no_connection} = diameter:call(CN, unknown_alias, Req).
  909: 
  910: %% Send something that's discarded by prepare_request.
  911: send_discard(Config) ->
  912:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  913:     {error, unprepared} = call(Config, Req).
  914: 
  915: %% Send with a disjunctive filter.
  916: send_any_1(Config) ->
  917:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  918:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {any, []}}]).
  919: send_any_2(Config) ->
  920:     #group{server_service = SN}
  921:         = group(Config),
  922:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  923:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  924:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
  925:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {first, [{all, [host, realm]},
  926:                                                realm]}}]).
  927: 
  928: %% Send with a conjunctive filter.
  929: send_all_1(Config) ->
  930:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  931:     Realm = lists:foldr(fun(C,A) -> [C,A] end, [], ?REALM),
  932:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  933:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  934:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [{host, any},
  935:                                              {realm, Realm}]}}]).
  936: send_all_2(Config) ->
  937:     #group{server_service = SN}
  938:         = group(Config),
  939:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  940:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
  941:     {error, no_connection}
  942:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  943: 
  944: %% Timeout before the server manages an answer.
  945: send_timeout(Config) ->
  946:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_ONLY}],
  947:     {timeout, _} = call(Config, Req, [{timeout, 1000}]).
  948: 
  949: %% Explicitly answer with an answer-message and ensure that we
  950: %% received the Session-Id.
  951: send_error(Config) ->
  952:     Req = ['RAR', {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_AUTHENTICATE}],
  953:     ?answer_message([_], ?TOO_BUSY)
  954:         = call(Config, Req).
  955: 
  956: %% Send a request with the detached option and receive it as a message
  957: %% from handle_answer instead.
  958: send_detach(Config) ->
  959:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  960:     Ref = make_ref(),
  961:     ok = call(Config, Req, [{extra, [{self(), Ref}]}, detach]),
  962:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  963:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  964:         = receive {Ref, T} -> T end.
  965: 
  966: %% Send a request which can't be encoded and expect {error, encode}.
  967: send_encode_error(Config) ->
  968:     {error, encode} = call(Config, ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', huh}]).
  969: 
  970: %% Send with filtering and expect success.
  971: send_destination_1(Config) ->
  972:     #group{server_service = SN}
  973:         = group(Config),
  974:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  975:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ?REALM)]}],
  976:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  977:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  978:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  979: send_destination_2(Config) ->
  980:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
  981:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
  982:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
  983:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  984: 
  985: %% Send with filtering on and expect failure when specifying an
  986: %% unknown host or realm.
  987: send_destination_3(Config) ->
  988:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  989:                   {'Destination-Realm', <<"unknown.org">>}],
  990:     {error, no_connection}
  991:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  992: send_destination_4(Config) ->
  993:     #group{server_service = SN}
  994:         = group(Config),
  995:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  996:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, ["unknown.org"])]}],
  997:     {error, no_connection}
  998:         = call(Config, Req, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
  999: 
 1000: %% Send without filtering and expect an error answer when specifying
 1001: %% an unknown host or realm.
 1002: send_destination_5(Config) ->
 1003:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
 1004:                   {'Destination-Realm', [<<"unknown.org">>]}],
 1005:     ?answer_message(?REALM_NOT_SERVED)
 1006:         = call(Config, Req).
 1007: send_destination_6(Config) ->
 1008:     #group{server_service = SN}
 1009:         = group(Config),
 1010:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
 1011:                   {'Destination-Host', [?HOST(SN, "unknown.org")]}],
 1012:     ?answer_message(?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER)
 1013:         = call(Config, Req).
 1014: 
 1015: %% Send unknown host in diameter_packet with filtering and expect error.
 1016: send_destination_7(Config) ->
 1017:     #group{client_service = CN,
 1018:            client_dict = Dict0}
 1019:         = group(Config),
 1020:     Name = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
 1021:     Svc = ?UNIQUE_STRING(),
 1022:     SN = [$S | Svc],
 1023:     Req =
 1024:         #diameter_packet{msg = ['STR' |
 1025:                                 #{'Termination-Cause' => ?LOGOUT,
 1026:                                   'Destination-Host' => [?HOST(SN, ?REALM)]}]},
 1027:     {error, no_connection} =
 1028:         diameter:call(CN,
 1029:                       Dict0,
 1030:                       Req,
 1031:                       [{extra, [Name, diameter_lib:now()]},
 1032:                        {filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]).
 1033: 
 1034: %% Specify an invalid option and expect failure.
 1035: send_bad_option_1(Config) ->
 1036:     send_bad_option(Config, x).
 1037: send_bad_option_2(Config) ->
 1038:     send_bad_option(Config, {extra, false}).
 1039: 
 1040: send_bad_option(Config, Opt) ->
 1041:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1042:     try call(Config, Req, [Opt]) of
 1043:         T -> erlang:error({?MODULE, ?LINE, T})
 1044:     catch
 1045:         error: _ -> ok
 1046:     end.
 1047: 
 1048: %% Specify an invalid filter and expect no matching peers.
 1049: send_bad_filter_1(Config) ->
 1050:     send_bad_filter(Config, {all, none}).
 1051: send_bad_filter_2(Config) ->
 1052:     send_bad_filter(Config, {host, x}).
 1053: send_bad_filter_3(Config) ->
 1054:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, fun() -> true end}).
 1055: send_bad_filter_4(Config) ->
 1056:     send_bad_filter(Config, {eval, {?MODULE, not_exported, []}}).
 1057: 
 1058: send_bad_filter(Config, F) ->
 1059:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1060:     {error, no_connection} = call(Config, Req, [{filter, F}]).
 1061: 
 1062: %% Specify multiple filter options and expect them be conjunctive.
 1063: send_multiple_filters_1(Config) ->
 1064:     Fun = fun(#diameter_caps{}) -> true end,
 1065:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1066:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1067:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [host, {eval, Fun}]).
 1068: send_multiple_filters_2(Config) ->
 1069:     E = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
 1070:     {error, no_connection}
 1071:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [realm, {neg, {eval, E}}]).
 1072: send_multiple_filters_3(Config) ->
 1073:     E1 = [fun(#diameter_caps{}, ok) -> true end, ok],
 1074:     E2 = {erlang, is_tuple, []},
 1075:     E3 = {erlang, is_record, [diameter_caps]},
 1076:     E4 = [{erlang, is_record, []}, diameter_caps],
 1077:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1078:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1079:         = send_multiple_filters(Config, [{eval, E} || E <- [E1,E2,E3,E4]]).
 1080: 
 1081: send_multiple_filters(Config, Fs) ->
 1082:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1083:     call(Config, Req, [{filter, F} || F <- Fs]).
 1084: 
 1085: %% Ensure that we can pass a request in any form to diameter:call/4,
 1086: %% only the return value from the prepare_request callback being
 1087: %% significant.
 1088: send_anything(Config) ->
 1089:     ['STA' | #{'Session-Id' := _,
 1090:                'Result-Code' := ?SUCCESS}]
 1091:         = call(Config, anything).
 1092: 
 1093: %% ===========================================================================
 1094: 
 1095: group(#group{} = Rec) ->
 1096:     Rec;
 1097: group(Config) ->
 1098:     #group{} = proplists:get_value(group, Config).
 1099: 
 1100: string(V, Config) ->
 1101:     #group{strings = B} = group(Config),
 1102:     decode(V,B).
 1103: 
 1104: decode(S, true)
 1105:   when is_list(S) ->
 1106:     S;
 1107: decode(B, false)
 1108:   when is_binary(B) ->
 1109:     binary_to_list(B).
 1110: 
 1111: call(Config, Req) ->
 1112:     call(Config, Req, []).
 1113: 
 1114: call(Config, Req, Opts) ->
 1115:     Name = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
 1116:     #group{encoding = Enc,
 1117:            client_service = CN,
 1118:            client_dict = Dict0}
 1119:         = group(Config),
 1120:     diameter:call(CN,
 1121:                   dict(Req, Dict0),
 1122:                   msg(Req, Enc, Dict0),
 1123:                   [{extra, [Name, diameter_lib:now()]} | Opts]).
 1124: 
 1125: origin({D,E}) ->
 1126:     4*decode(D) + encode(E);
 1127: 
 1128: origin(N) ->
 1129:     {decode(N bsr 2), encode(N rem 4)}.
 1130: 
 1131: %% Map atoms. The atoms are part of (constructed) group names, so it's
 1132: %% good that they're readable.
 1133: 
 1134: decode(record) -> 0;
 1135: decode(list)   -> 1;
 1136: decode(map)    -> 2;
 1137: decode(none)   -> 3;
 1138: decode(record_from_map) -> 4;
 1139: decode(0) -> record;
 1140: decode(1) -> list;
 1141: decode(2) -> map;
 1142: decode(3) -> none;
 1143: decode(4) -> record_from_map.
 1144: 
 1145: encode(record) -> 0;
 1146: encode(list)   -> 1;
 1147: encode(map)    -> 2;
 1148: encode(0) -> record;
 1149: encode(1) -> list;
 1150: encode(2) -> map.
 1151: 
 1152: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588)
 1153:   when H == 'ACR';
 1154:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1155:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_base_accounting);
 1156: 
 1157: msg([H|_] = Msg, record = E, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733)
 1158:   when H == 'ACR';
 1159:        H == 'ACA' ->
 1160:     msg(Msg, E, diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733);
 1161: 
 1162: msg([H|T], record, Dict) ->
 1163:     Dict:'#new-'(Dict:msg2rec(H), T);
 1164: 
 1165: msg([H|As], map, _)
 1166:   when is_list(As) ->
 1167:     [H | maps:from_list(As)];
 1168: 
 1169: msg(Msg, _, _) ->
 1170:     Msg.
 1171: 
 1172: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [_MsgName | Avps] = Msg},
 1173:        #group{server_decoding = map})
 1174:   when is_map(Avps) ->
 1175:     Msg;
 1176: 
 1177: to_map(#diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | Avps]},
 1178:        #group{server_decoding = list}) ->
 1179:     [MsgName | maps:from_list(Avps)];
 1180: 
 1181: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Rec},
 1182:        #group{server_decoding = D})
 1183:   when D == record;
 1184:        D == record_from_map ->
 1185:     rec_to_map(Rec, dict(H));
 1186: 
 1187: %% No record decode: do it ourselves.
 1188: to_map(#diameter_packet{header = H,
 1189:                         msg = Name,
 1190:                         bin = Bin},
 1191:       #group{server_decoding = none,
 1192:              strings = B}) ->
 1193:     Opts = #{decode_format => map,
 1194:              string_decode => B,
 1195:              avp_dictionaries => [diameter_gen_doic_rfc7683],
 1196:              strict_mbit => true,
 1197:              rfc => 6733},
 1198:     #diameter_packet{msg = [MsgName | _Map] = Msg}
 1199:         = diameter_codec:decode(dict(H), Opts, Bin),
 1200:     {MsgName, _} = {Name, Msg},  %% assert
 1201:     Msg.
 1202: 
 1203: dict(#diameter_header{application_id = Id,
 1204:                       cmd_code = Code}) ->
 1205:     if Id == 1 ->
 1206:             nas4005;
 1207:        Code == 271 ->
 1208:             diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1209:        true ->
 1210:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1211:     end.
 1212: 
 1213: rec_to_map(Rec, Dict) ->
 1214:     [R | Vs] = Dict:'#get-'(Rec),
 1215:     [Dict:rec2msg(R) | maps:from_list([T || {_,V} = T <- Vs,
 1216:                                             V /= undefined,
 1217:                                             V /= []])].
 1218: 
 1219: appdict(rfc4005) ->
 1220:     nas4005;
 1221: appdict(D) ->
 1222:     dict0(D).
 1223: 
 1224: dict0(D) ->
 1225:     ?A("diameter_gen_base_" ++ ?L(D)).
 1226: 
 1227: dict(Msg, Dict) ->
 1228:     d(name(Msg), Dict).
 1229: 
 1230: d(N, nas4005 = D) ->
 1231:     if N == {list, 'answer-message'};
 1232:        N == {map, 'answer-message'};
 1233:        N == {record, 'diameter_base_answer-message'} ->
 1234:             diameter_gen_base_rfc3588;
 1235:        true ->
 1236:             D
 1237:     end;
 1238: d(N, Dict0)
 1239:   when N == {list, 'ACR'};
 1240:        N == {list, 'ACA'};
 1241:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1242:        N == {map, 'ACA'};
 1243:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1244:        N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACA} ->
 1245:     acct(Dict0);
 1246: d(_, Dict0) ->
 1247:     Dict0.
 1248: 
 1249: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc3588) ->
 1250:     diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1251: acct(diameter_gen_base_rfc6733) ->
 1252:     diameter_gen_acct_rfc6733.
 1253: 
 1254: %% Set only values that aren't already.
 1255: 
 1256: set(_, [N | As], Vs) ->
 1257:     [N | if is_map(As) ->
 1258:                  maps:merge(maps:from_list(Vs), As);
 1259:             is_list(As) ->
 1260:                  Vs ++ As
 1261:          end];
 1262: 
 1263: set(#group{client_dict = Dict0} = _Group, Rec, Vs) ->
 1264:     Dict = dict(Rec, Dict0),
 1265:     lists:foldl(fun({F,_} = FV, A) ->
 1266:                         reset(Dict, Dict:'#get-'(F, A), FV, A)
 1267:                 end,
 1268:                 Rec,
 1269:                 Vs).
 1270: 
 1271: reset(Dict, E, FV, Rec)
 1272:   when E == undefined;
 1273:        E == [] ->
 1274:     Dict:'#set-'(FV, Rec);
 1275: 
 1276: reset(_, _, _, Rec) ->
 1277:     Rec.
 1278: 
 1279: %% ===========================================================================
 1280: %% diameter callbacks
 1281: 
 1282: %% peer_up/4
 1283: 
 1284: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1285:     State.
 1286: 
 1287: %% peer_down/3
 1288: 
 1289: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State, _Group) ->
 1290:     State.
 1291: 
 1292: %% pick_peer/7-8
 1293: 
 1294: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, Name, _)
 1295:   when Name /= send_detach ->
 1296:     find(Group, Peers).
 1297: 
 1298: pick_peer(_Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, _Group, send_nopeer, _, ?EXTRA) ->
 1299:     false;
 1300: 
 1301: pick_peer(Peers, _, [$C|_], _State, Group, send_detach, _, {_,_}) ->
 1302:     find(Group, Peers).
 1303: 
 1304: find(#group{encoding = E,
 1305:             client_service = CN,
 1306:             server_decoding = D},
 1307:      [_|_] = Peers) ->
 1308:     Id = {D,E},
 1309:     [P] = [P || P <- Peers, id(Id, P, CN)],
 1310:     {ok, P}.
 1311: 
 1312: id(Id, {Pid, _Caps}, SvcName) ->
 1313:     [{ref, _}, {type, _}, {options, Opts} | _]
 1314:         = diameter:service_info(SvcName, Pid),
 1315:     lists:member({id, Id}, Opts).
 1316: 
 1317: %% prepare_request/6-7
 1318: prepare_request(_Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, _Caps}, _, send_discard, _) ->
 1319:     {discard, unprepared};
 1320: 
 1321: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, Name, _) ->
 1322:     {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Name, Group)}.
 1323: 
 1324: prepare_request(Pkt, [$C|_], {_Ref, Caps}, Group, send_detach, _, _) ->
 1325:     {eval_packet, {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)}, [fun log/2, detach]}.
 1326: 
 1327: log(#diameter_packet{bin = Bin} = P, T)
 1328:   when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1329:     io:format("~p: ~p~n", [T,P]).
 1330: 
 1331: %% prepare/4
 1332: 
 1333: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1334:   when N == send_unknown_short_mandatory;
 1335:        N == send_unknown_short ->
 1336:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1337: 
 1338:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1339:                      bin = Bin}
 1340:         = E
 1341:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1342: 
 1343:     %% Find the unknown AVP data at the end of the message and alter
 1344:     %% its length header.
 1345: 
 1346:     {Padding, [17|_]} = lists:splitwith(fun(C) -> C == 0 end,
 1347:                                        lists:reverse(binary_to_list(Bin))),
 1348: 
 1349:     Offset = L - length(Padding) - 4,
 1350:     <<H:Offset/binary, Len:24, T/binary>> = Bin,
 1351:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, (Len+9):24, T/binary>>};
 1352: 
 1353: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1354:   when N == send_long_avp_length;
 1355:        N == send_short_avp_length;
 1356:        N == send_zero_avp_length ->
 1357:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1358:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1359:     %% Unsigned32: set AVP Length to a value other than 12 and place
 1360:     %% it last in the message (so as not to mess with Termination-Cause).
 1361:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1362:                      bin = B}
 1363:         = E
 1364:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1365:     Offset = L - 24,  %% to Auth-Application-Id
 1366:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1367:       Hdr:5/binary, 12:24, Data:4/binary,
 1368:       T:12/binary>>
 1369:         = B,
 1370:     AL = case N of
 1371:              send_long_avp_length  -> 13;
 1372:              send_short_avp_length -> 11;
 1373:              send_zero_avp_length  -> 0
 1374:          end,
 1375:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1376:                               T/binary,
 1377:                               Hdr/binary, AL:24, Data/binary>>};
 1378: 
 1379: prepare(Pkt, Caps, N, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group)
 1380:   when N == send_invalid_avp_length;
 1381:        N == send_invalid_reject ->
 1382:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1383:     %% Second last AVP in our STR is Auth-Application-Id of type
 1384:     %% Unsigned32: send data of length 8.
 1385:     #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{length = L},
 1386:                      bin = B0}
 1387:         = E
 1388:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1389:     Offset = L - 7 - 12,  %% to AVP Length
 1390:     <<H0:Offset/binary, 12:24, T:16/binary>> = B0,
 1391:     <<V, L:24, H/binary>> = H0,  %% assert
 1392:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (L+4):24, H/binary, 16:24, 0:32, T/binary>>};
 1393: 
 1394: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unexpected_mandatory, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1395:                                               = Group) ->
 1396:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1397:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<V, Len:24, T/binary>>}
 1398:         = E
 1399:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1400:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-State'),
 1401:     Avp = <<Code:32, Flags, 8:24>>,
 1402:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<V, (Len+8):24, T/binary, Avp/binary>>};
 1403: 
 1404: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_grouped_error, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1405:                                               = Group) ->
 1406:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1407:     #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}
 1408:         = E
 1409:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1410:     {Code, Flags, undefined} = Dict0:avp_header('Proxy-Info'),
 1411:     %% Find Proxy-Info by looking for its header.
 1412:     Pattern = <<Code:32, Flags, 28:24>>,
 1413:     {Offset, 8} = binary:match(Bin, Pattern),
 1414: 
 1415:     %% Extract and swap Proxy-Host/State payloads.
 1416: 
 1417:     <<H:Offset/binary,
 1418:       PI:8/binary,
 1419:       PH:5/binary,
 1420:       12:24,
 1421:       Payload:4/binary,
 1422:       PS:5/binary,
 1423:       8:24,
 1424:       T/binary>>
 1425:         = Bin,
 1426: 
 1427:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary,
 1428:                               PI/binary,
 1429:                               PH/binary,
 1430:                               8:24,
 1431:                               PS:5/binary,
 1432:                               12:24,
 1433:                               Payload/binary,
 1434:                               T/binary>>};
 1435: 
 1436: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported, #group{client_dict = Dict0} = Group) ->
 1437:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1438:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:5/binary, _CmdCode:3/binary, T/binary>>}
 1439:         = E
 1440:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1441:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, 42:24, T/binary>>};
 1442: 
 1443: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_app, #group{client_dict = Dict0}
 1444:                                          = Group) ->
 1445:     Req = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group),
 1446:     #diameter_packet{bin = <<H:8/binary, _ApplId:4/binary, T/binary>>}
 1447:         = E
 1448:         = diameter_codec:encode(Dict0, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}),
 1449:     E#diameter_packet{bin = <<H/binary, ?BAD_APP:32, T/binary>>};
 1450: 
 1451: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_error_bit, Group) ->
 1452:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1453:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{is_error = true},
 1454:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1455: 
 1456: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_unsupported_version, Group) ->
 1457:     #diameter_packet{header = Hdr} = Pkt,
 1458:     Pkt#diameter_packet{header = Hdr#diameter_header{version = 42},
 1459:                         msg = prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group)};
 1460: 
 1461: prepare(Pkt, Caps, send_anything, Group) ->
 1462:     Req = ['STR', {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT}],
 1463:     prepare(Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group);
 1464: 
 1465: prepare(Pkt, Caps, _Name, Group) ->
 1466:     prepare(Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1467: 
 1468: %% prepare/3
 1469: 
 1470: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = Req} = Pkt, Caps, Group) ->
 1471:     set(name(Req), Pkt, Caps, Group).
 1472: 
 1473: %% set/4
 1474: 
 1475: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1476:   when N == {record, diameter_base_accounting_ACR};
 1477:        N == {record, nas_ACR};
 1478:        N == {map, 'ACR'};
 1479:        N == {list, 'ACR'} ->
 1480:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1481:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1482:         = Caps,
 1483: 
 1484:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1485:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1486:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1487:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]}]);
 1488: 
 1489: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1490:   when N == {record, diameter_base_ASR};
 1491:        N == {record, nas_ASR};
 1492:        N == {map, 'ASR'};
 1493:        N == {list, 'ASR'} ->
 1494:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1495:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1496:         = Caps,
 1497:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1498:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1499:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1500:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1501:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1502:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1503: 
 1504: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1505:   when N == {record, diameter_base_STR};
 1506:        N == {record, nas_STR};
 1507:        N == {map, 'STR'};
 1508:        N == {list, 'STR'} ->
 1509:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1510:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1511:         = Caps,
 1512:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1513:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1514:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1515:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1516:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]);
 1517: 
 1518: set(N, #diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps, Group)
 1519:   when N == {record, diameter_base_RAR};
 1520:        N == {record, nas_RAR};
 1521:        N == {map, 'RAR'};
 1522:        N == {list, 'RAR'} ->
 1523:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, DH},
 1524:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
 1525:         = Caps,
 1526:     set(Group, Req, [{'Session-Id', [diameter:session_id(OH)]},
 1527:                      {'Origin-Host',  [OH]},
 1528:                      {'Origin-Realm', [OR]},
 1529:                      {'Destination-Host',  [DH]},
 1530:                      {'Destination-Realm', [DR]},
 1531:                      {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}]).
 1532: 
 1533: %% name/1
 1534: 
 1535: name([H|#{}]) ->
 1536:     {map, H};
 1537: 
 1538: name([H|_]) ->
 1539:     {list, H};
 1540: 
 1541: name(Rec) ->
 1542:     try
 1543:         {record, element(1, Rec)}
 1544:     catch
 1545:         error: badarg ->
 1546:             false
 1547:     end.
 1548: 
 1549: %% prepare_retransmit/6
 1550: 
 1551: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer, _Group, _Name, _) ->
 1552:     discard.
 1553: 
 1554: %% handle_answer/7-8
 1555: 
 1556: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, Name, _) ->
 1557:     answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group).
 1558: 
 1559: handle_answer(Pkt, Req, [$C|_], Peer, Group, send_detach = Name, _, X) ->
 1560:     {Pid, Ref} = X,
 1561:     Pid ! {Ref, answer(Pkt, Req, Peer, Name, Group)}.
 1562: 
 1563: answer(Pkt, Req, _Peer, Name, #group{client_dict = Dict0}) ->
 1564:     #diameter_packet{header = H, msg = Ans, errors = Es} = Pkt,
 1565:     ApplId = app(Req, Name, Dict0),
 1566:     #diameter_header{application_id = ApplId} = H,  %% assert
 1567:     answer(Ans, Es, Name).
 1568: 
 1569: %% Missing Result-Code and inappropriate Experimental-Result-Code.
 1570: answer(Ans, Es, send_experimental_result) ->
 1571:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result'}},
 1572:      {5005, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}}]
 1573:         =  Es,
 1574:     Ans;
 1575: 
 1576: %% An inappropriate E-bit results in a decode error ...
 1577: answer(Ans, Es, send_bad_answer) ->
 1578:     [{5004, #diameter_avp{name = 'Result-Code'}} | _] = Es,
 1579:     Ans;
 1580: 
 1581: %% ... while other errors are reflected in Failed-AVP.
 1582: answer(Ans, [], _) ->
 1583:     Ans.
 1584: 
 1585: app(_, send_unsupported_app, _) ->
 1586:     ?BAD_APP;
 1587: app(Req, _, Dict0) ->
 1588:     Dict = dict(Req, Dict0),
 1589:     Dict:id().
 1590: 
 1591: %% handle_error/7
 1592: 
 1593: handle_error(timeout = Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, Time) ->
 1594:     Now = diameter_lib:now(),
 1595:     {Reason, {diameter_lib:timestamp(Time),
 1596:               diameter_lib:timestamp(Now),
 1597:               diameter_lib:micro_diff(Now, Time)}};
 1598: 
 1599: handle_error(Reason, _Req, [$C|_], _Peer, _, _, _Time) ->
 1600:     {error, Reason}.
 1601: 
 1602: %% handle_request/4
 1603: 
 1604: %% Note that diameter will set Result-Code and Failed-AVPs if
 1605: %% #diameter_packet.errors is non-null.
 1606: 
 1607: handle_request(#diameter_packet{header = H, avps = As}
 1608:                = Pkt,
 1609:                _,
 1610:                {_Ref, Caps},
 1611:                #group{encoding = E,
 1612:                       server_decoding = D}
 1613:                = Grp) ->
 1614:     #diameter_header{end_to_end_id = EI,
 1615:                      hop_by_hop_id = HI}
 1616:         = H,
 1617:     {V,B} = ?CLIENT_MASK,
 1618:     V = EI bsr B,  %% assert
 1619:     V = HI bsr B,  %%
 1620:     #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {_,[Id]}} = Caps,
 1621:     {D,E} = T = origin(Id),  %% assert
 1622:     wrap(T, H, request(to_map(Pkt, Grp), [H|As], Caps)).
 1623: 
 1624: wrap(Id, H, {Tag, Action, Post}) ->
 1625:     {Tag, wrap(Id, H, Action), Post};
 1626: 
 1627: wrap(_, _, {reply, [#diameter_header{} | _]} = T) ->
 1628:     T;
 1629: 
 1630: wrap({_,E}, H, {reply, Ans}) ->
 1631:     Msg = base_to_nas(msg(Ans, E, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588), H),
 1632:     {reply, wrap(Msg)};
 1633: 
 1634: wrap(_, _, T) ->
 1635:     T.
 1636: 
 1637: %% Randomly wrap the answer in a diameter_packet.
 1638: 
 1639: wrap(#diameter_packet{} = Pkt) ->
 1640:     Pkt;
 1641: 
 1642: wrap(Msg) ->
 1643:     case rand:uniform(2) of
 1644:         1 -> #diameter_packet{msg = Msg};
 1645:         2 -> Msg
 1646:     end.
 1647: 
 1648: %% base_to_nas/2
 1649: 
 1650: base_to_nas(#diameter_packet{msg = Msg} = Pkt, H) ->
 1651:     Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = base_to_nas(Msg, H)};
 1652: 
 1653: base_to_nas(Rec, #diameter_header{application_id = 1})
 1654:   when is_tuple(Rec), not ?is_record(Rec, 'diameter_base_answer-message') ->
 1655:     D = case element(1, Rec) of
 1656:             diameter_base_accounting_ACA ->
 1657:                 diameter_gen_base_accounting;
 1658:             _ ->
 1659:                 diameter_gen_base_rfc3588
 1660:         end,
 1661:     [R | Values] = D:'#get-'(Rec),
 1662:     "diameter_base_" ++ N = ?L(R),
 1663:     Name = ?A("nas_" ++ if N == "accounting_ACA" ->
 1664:                                 "ACA";
 1665:                            true ->
 1666:                                 N
 1667:                         end),
 1668:     nas4005:'#new-'([Name | Values]);
 1669: 
 1670: base_to_nas(Msg, _) ->
 1671:     Msg.
 1672: 
 1673: %% request/3
 1674: 
 1675: %% send_experimental_result
 1676: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 5}],
 1677:         [Hdr | Avps],
 1678:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1679:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1680:     [H,R|T] = [A || N <- ['Origin-Host',
 1681:                           'Origin-Realm',
 1682:                           'Session-Id',
 1683:                           'Accounting-Record-Type',
 1684:                           'Accounting-Record-Number'],
 1685:                     #diameter_avp{} = A
 1686:                         <- [lists:keyfind(N, #diameter_avp.name, Avps)]],
 1687:     Ans = [Hdr#diameter_header{is_request = false},
 1688:            H#diameter_avp{data = OH},
 1689:            R#diameter_avp{data = OR},
 1690:            #diameter_avp{name = 'Experimental-Result',
 1691:                          code = 297,
 1692:                          need_encryption = false,
 1693:                          data = [#diameter_avp{data = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1694:                                                        'Vendor-Id',
 1695:                                                        123}},
 1696:                                  #diameter_avp{data
 1697:                                                = {?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON,
 1698:                                                   'Experimental-Result-Code',
 1699:                                                   3987}}]}
 1700:            | T],
 1701:     {reply, Ans};
 1702: 
 1703: request(Msg, _Avps, Caps) ->
 1704:     request(Msg, Caps).
 1705: 
 1706: %% request/2
 1707: 
 1708: %% send_nok
 1709: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 0}],
 1710:         _) ->
 1711:     {eval_packet, {protocol_error, ?INVALID_AVP_BITS}, [fun log/2, invalid]};
 1712: 
 1713: %% send_bad_answer
 1714: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1715:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1716:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 2 = RN}],
 1717:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1718:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1719:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1720:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1721:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1722:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1723:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1724:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1725: 
 1726:     {reply, #diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{is_error = true},%% NOT
 1727:                              msg = Ans}};
 1728: 
 1729: %% send_eval
 1730: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1731:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1732:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 3 = RN}],
 1733:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1734:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1735:     Ans = ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1736:                   {'Session-Id', SId},
 1737:                   {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1738:                   {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1739:                   {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1740:                   {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}],
 1741:     {eval, {reply, Ans}, {erlang, now, []}};
 1742: 
 1743: %% send_ok
 1744: request(['ACR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId,
 1745:                    'Accounting-Record-Type' := RT,
 1746:                    'Accounting-Record-Number' := 1 = RN}],
 1747:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1748:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1749:     {reply, ['ACA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1750:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1751:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1752:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1753:                     {'Accounting-Record-Type', RT},
 1754:                     {'Accounting-Record-Number', RN}]};
 1755: 
 1756: %% send_protocol_error
 1757: request(['ACR' | #{'Accounting-Record-Number' := 4}],
 1758:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1759:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1760:     %% Include a DOIC AVP that will be encoded/decoded because of
 1761:     %% avp_dictionaries config.
 1762:     OLR = #{'OC-Sequence-Number' => 1,
 1763:             'OC-Report-Type' => 0,  %% HOST_REPORT
 1764:             'OC-Reduction-Percentage' => [25],
 1765:             'OC-Validity-Duration' => [60],
 1766:             'AVP' => [{'OC-Supported-Features', []}]},
 1767:     %% Include a NAS Failed-AVP AVP that will only be decoded under
 1768:     %% that application. Encode as 'AVP' since RFC 3588 doesn't list
 1769:     %% Failed-AVP in the answer-message grammar while RFC 6733 does.
 1770:     NP = #diameter_avp{data = {nas4005, 'NAS-Port', 44}},
 1771:     FR = #diameter_avp{name = 'Firmware-Revision', value = 12}, %% M=0
 1772:     AP = #diameter_avp{name = 'Auth-Grace-Period', value = 13}, %% M=1
 1773:     Failed = #diameter_avp{data = {diameter_gen_base_rfc3588,
 1774:                                    'Failed-AVP',
 1775:                                    [{'AVP', [NP,FR,AP]}]}},
 1776:     Ans = ['answer-message', {'Result-Code', ?TOO_BUSY},
 1777:                              {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1778:                              {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1779:                              {'AVP', [{'OC-OLR', OLR}, Failed]}],
 1780:     {reply, Ans};
 1781: 
 1782: %% send_proxy_info
 1783: request(['ASR' | #{'Proxy-Info' := _}],
 1784:         _) ->
 1785:     {protocol_error, 3999};
 1786: 
 1787: request(['ASR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId} = Avps],
 1788:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _},
 1789:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1790:     {reply, ['ASA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1791:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1792:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1793:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR},
 1794:                     {'AVP', maps:get('AVP', Avps, [])}]};
 1795: 
 1796: %% send_invalid_reject
 1797: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := ?USER_MOVED}],
 1798:         _Caps) ->
 1799:     {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY};
 1800: 
 1801: %% send_noreply
 1802: request(['STR' | #{'Termination-Cause' := T}],
 1803:         _Caps)
 1804:   when T /= ?LOGOUT ->
 1805:     discard;
 1806: 
 1807: %% send_destination_5
 1808: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Realm' := R}],
 1809:         #diameter_caps{origin_realm = {OR, _}})
 1810:   when R /= undefined, R /= OR ->
 1811:     {protocol_error, ?REALM_NOT_SERVED};
 1812: 
 1813: %% send_destination_6
 1814: request(['STR' | #{'Destination-Host' := [H]}],
 1815:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _}})
 1816:   when H /= OH ->
 1817:     {protocol_error, ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER};
 1818: 
 1819: request(['STR' | #{'Session-Id' := SId}],
 1820:         #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
 1821:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
 1822:     {reply, ['STA', {'Result-Code', ?SUCCESS},
 1823:                     {'Session-Id', SId},
 1824:                     {'Origin-Host', OH},
 1825:                     {'Origin-Realm', OR}]};
 1826: 
 1827: %% send_error/send_timeout
 1828: request(['RAR' | #{}], _Caps) ->
 1829:     receive after 2000 -> {protocol_error, ?TOO_BUSY} end.
 1830: 
 1831: %% message/3
 1832: %%
 1833: %% Limit the number of messages received. More can be received if read
 1834: %% in the same packet.
 1835: 
 1836: message(recv = D, {[_], Bin}, N) ->
 1837:     message(D, Bin, N);
 1838: message(Dir, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}, N) ->
 1839:     message(Dir, Bin, N);
 1840: 
 1841: %% incoming request
 1842: message(recv, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>> = Bin, N) ->
 1843:     [Bin, N < 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N+1];
 1844: 
 1845: %% incoming answer
 1846: message(recv, Bin, _) ->
 1847:     [Bin];
 1848: 
 1849: %% outgoing
 1850: message(send, Bin, _) ->
 1851:     [Bin];
 1852: 
 1853: %% sent request
 1854: message(ack, <<_:32, 1:1, _/bits>>, _) ->
 1855:     [];
 1856: 
 1857: %% sent answer or discarded request
 1858: message(ack, _, N) ->
 1859:     [N =< 16, fun ?MODULE:message/3, N-1].
 1860: 
 1861: %% ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1862: 
 1863: compile_and_load() ->
 1864:     Path = hd([P || H <- [[here(), ".."], [code:lib_dir(diameter)]],
 1865:                     P <- [filename:join(H ++ ["examples",
 1866:                                               "dict",
 1867:                                               "rfc4005_nas.dia"])],
 1868:                     {ok, _} <- [file:read_file_info(P)]]),
 1869:     Opts = [return,
 1870:             forms,
 1871:             {name, "nas4005"},
 1872:             {prefix, "nas"},
 1873:             {inherits, "common/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588"}],
 1874:     {ok, [Forms]} = diameter_make:codec(Path, Opts),
 1875:     {ok, nas4005, Bin, []} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info, return]),
 1876:     {module, nas4005} = code:load_binary(nas4005, "nas4005", Bin).
 1877: 
 1878: here() ->
 1879:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
